page.title: 03NATURE IN CRESSBROOK DALE
page.content: {ECOLOGY CRESSBROOK WARDLOW Half this limestone area is improved grassland and arable land,one quarter designated of special interest being owned or leased by the{Peak National {Park}as a Nature Reserve. {CRESSBROOK DALE}is typical of the Derbyshire Dales,being rich and diverse in grassland flora,eg.orchids, daphne and sedges.Flowing through the gorge is a seasonal river which feeds ponds of breeding trout used for stocking the River Wye.On the western slope of the dale is a deciduous plantation.On the east are ancient woodlands of ash and elm.Hazel coppices provide ground cover for hellebores.A moss of international importance is found here.Badgers,a protected species,are of local importance.About 20 species of butterfly have been identified.
